page.title: 02Ecology and Environment
page.content: The study area is located on the edge of the{Berksire Downs,}a range of {chalk hills}which provides a gently undulating landscape of woodland, hedgerows and grassland. Although much of the area is cultivated, some slopes are too steep for machinery and are covered in grass or deciduous woodland. The natural{woodland includes most commonly{oaks, beeches, {horse chestnuts, sycamores}with occasional{limes, elms,}and{willow trees can be found along the banks of the{Pang.}Foxhunting and steep hillsides have encouraged farmers to keep the fields small and permit the growth of tall hedgerows. Common mammals include{rabbits, hares, grey {squirrels, hedgehogs, small rodents and{fallow deer}while there is evidence of{badgers}and{foxes,}these are rarely seen.
